page.title: 01Country in Southwest Surrey
page.content: Much of this block consists of woodland with a number of small farms now mainly growing grass for grazing sheep, horses and cattle. The western part contains the southern part of Witley Park. From certain places the views towards Hindhead and Blackdown are striking. The main railway-line from London to Portsmouth goes through the block with a fairly steep gradient going south-west towards Haslemere. The southeastern corner includes the western part of Chidding Fold. With Witley station in the block many residents are commuters to London with others working locally. A few work at the old-established stick factory near the station, an important producer of sticks for walking and for hospitals. Near the station there is also a small residential area.
